content: soon store this tail inside of your lamp round 12 knit round 13 purl round 14 knit round 15 purl embroidery so it is easier the candle embroidery is done now instead of at the end during your embroidery your knitted stitches remain on the needles you will use a combination of short and long stitches figure a shows where the stitches are located and figure b the ends knotted together and hidden inside candle for the white candle i recommend a thicker yarn worsted so you only have to do 1 stitch i entered my needle in the top green stitch middle and travelled up about 4 stitches when done knot the two ends together for the flame make a shorter stitch sometimes i like to make one chain stitch as i think it resembles a flame shape again knot the 2 ends together and hide inside for the 2 brown vertical stitches use the cap colored end you saved earlier make 2 long stitches either side of the candle knot the remaining end to the inside of your work to secure it in place now back to your knitting round 16 ssk k4 k2tog repeat 12 sts round 17 purl stuff your lamp if you are planning on adding a pole don t overstuff it or it will be harder to fit round 18 ssk k2 k2tog repeat 8 sts round 19 ssk k2tog repeat 4 sts round 20-21 knit break yarn leaving an 8 /20cm end for the handle draw end through the remaining 4 stitches pull tight and secure with a knot using your end make a loop for the handle and knot to the opposite side my handles are about 1 5 /4cm high hide end inside of stem if you do not want to add a pole use your cast on end to sew up the bottom and then hide end inside if you plan on using a toothpick for your pole you can also use your cast on end to sew up the bottom hole hide end inside and then simply poke the toothpick up through the fabric into place to use a stick for your pole first use one end of the scissors to push the stuffing to the front see figure c and doing the best you can it s sometimes a bit tricky push your stick/pole up into your lamp to make it more secure you can add a running stitch to the bottom of your lamp with your cast on end pull it tight secure and hide it in lamp congrats you now have an adorable acorn streetlamp for pattern support simply pm me on ravelry 3 display ideas house plants need lots of good light add a tassel to make a cute bookmark this scene is from week 2 of the itty bitty group s
